<@UEKMY50SU>
```exports.multiple1 = (context, sendResponse) => {
      // your code called when the function is executed
   const functionResponse = "first function";
  

      // sendResponse is a callback function you call to send your response.
   sendResponse({body: functionResponse, statusCode: 200});
};
exports.multiple2 = (context, sendResponse) => {
      // your code called when the function is executed
   const functionResponse = "second function";
  

      // sendResponse is a callback function you call to send your response.
   sendResponse({body: functionResponse, statusCode: 200});
};```
This is my multiple.js file code. i want to return different responses for multiple1 and multiple2 but i am unable do <http://this.Is|this.Is> this code correct ?

Hello all,
How can I install third party npm packages and use them in serverless function?one hint I have studied in developers docs  is to use it via webpack but still I am unable to do it . please someone  guide me on this .
 Thanks !

there's a new beta that allows this functionality via a `package.json` file. see the doc here: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vRGX60V2wQ2Co9X1NO73hkLObcQdNWp2i49XE-pY_DRS6UjZnv4UuODz4nsI_g1gUIXFC1MhN4AFsnZ/pub>
you should have a single `exports.main` function. you can then use the `context` to determine if you want to execute the logic for `multiple1` or `multiple2`
